metadata.title: CVE-2024-4032 on Ubuntu 24.10 (oracular) - low
metadata.description:
The “ipaddress” module contained incorrect information about whethercertain IPv4 and IPv6 addresses were designated as “globally reachable” or“private”. This affected the is_private and is_global properties of theipaddress.IPv4Address, ipaddress.IPv4Network, ipaddress.IPv6Address, andipaddress.IPv6Network classes, where values wouldn’t be returned inaccordance with the latest information from the IANA Special-PurposeAddress Registries. CPython 3.12.4 and 3.13.0a6 contain updated informationfrom these registries and thus have the intended behavior.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2024-4032` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

idle-python3.12 - 3.12.4-1ubuntu1
libpython3.12-minimal - 3.12.4-1ubuntu1
libpython3.12-stdlib - 3.12.4-1ubuntu1
libpython3.12-testsuite - 3.12.4-1ubuntu1
libpython3.12t64 - 3.12.4-1ubuntu1
python3.12 - 3.12.4-1ubuntu1
python3.12-examples - 3.12.4-1ubuntu1
python3.12-full - 3.12.4-1ubuntu1
python3.12-minimal - 3.12.4-1ubuntu1
python3.12-nopie - 3.12.4-1ubuntu1
python3.12-venv - 3.12.4-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: python3.12 package in oracular, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.12.4-1ubuntu1').
